name: One Pot Garlic Parmesan Pasta
description: The easiest and creamiest pasta made in a single pot - even the pasta gets cooked right in the pan! How easy is that?
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in chicken broth, milk and fettuccine; season with salt and pepper, to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in chicken broth, milk and fettuccine; season with salt and pepper, to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until pasta is cooked through, about 18-20 minutes. Stir in Parmesan. If the mixture is too thick, add more milk as needed until desired consistency is reached.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until pasta is cooked through, about 18-20 minutes. Stir in Parmesan. If the mixture is too thick, add more milk as needed until desired consistency is reached.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, garnished with parsley, if desired.

It was delicious although the needed a lot more liquids.  Is the pasta supposed to cook covered or uncovered ?   Thanks for sharing this recipe!

Absolutely!

We really like this recipie but how do you keep the pasta from sticking together when cooking ? I find I always have to go in a seperate it after then some pasta is uncooked.

This recipe is a staple in our house. I make it almost every week. My kids love pasta and this is an easy,  tasty alternative to spaghetti. You can pair it with chicken, sausages or on its own with a salad. A family hit all around! LOVE ❤️

I love when people review and add their alterations because it just goes to show. What can we use? If you don’t have or don’t like or can’t afford or allergic to something. Usually when I find these recipes because I’m looking for alterations.

LOVE this recipe! I've been making it for a few years now, and it's become a staple in our household! I add chicken and lemon zest (at the end) now, but it's a great, quick meal just as it is! Thanks for all of your great recipes!
Delicious! I've made this so many times and it always turns out great. You can really use any pasta, I've used elbows, spaghetti, penne, etc. I also used oat milk recently and it tasted just as good.
I’ve made this several times…as written and adding various proteins.  It’s a hit every time.  Making it tonight with rotisserie chicken.

I've made this a few times now. I have not had anyone complain so far. The sauce thickens up if you let it sit. When I made it too soon, I just added milk to make it creamy again. I'm making it tonight but am adding some frozen broccoli in with the noodles. This recipe is a great side with kitchen staples.

Love this recipe! This has been a great starter recipe for my 13 and 16 year olds. Never eat it without the Parmesan cheese - that’s where the wonderful flavour comes from. This probably gets made twice a month at our house and we’ve been enjoying it for many years!! If I’d had access to this recipe as a young adult living away from home I would’ve made it every week. And I agree with other commenters that it’s great with cooked chicken breast, broccoli, peas… Can’t say enough good stuff about it!
I made it and added some cooked, diced chicken breast. Taste is great!

Really nice, especially given how little work is required! However, if your pasta has a shorter cooking time (my fettucine only said 5-6 minutes on the box), maybe let the liquid simmer for a bit before adding pasta - with the shorter cooking time, the liquid didn't have as much time to evaporate, so the end result was very watery (but fortunately I was able to salvage it by adding more cheese and a little bit of flour).
I usually do not leave reviews, but this was too good not to.  Made it just as written and it was perfect and delicious.  Thanks for a wonderful pasta recipe!

Made this tonight and it was on point! Perfect
